# \textcolor{mybgcolor2}{Highlights}

\vspace*{-5truemm}

* \Large Designed and validated a \underline{\textbf{qPCR eDNA assay for sunflower stars }} (*Pycnopodia helianthoides*)
  * \small spawning a slough of new and ongoing research partnerships and funding to identify remnant populations in California, understand the drivers of eDNA fate and transport, and to benchmark quantitative abundance estimation.

* \Large \underline{\textbf{Tripled our lab processing and sequencing efficiency}} over the last two years,
  * \small increasing our ability to generate high throughput ocean biomolecular observations.

* \Large \underline{\textbf{Advanced our biomolecular data management workflows}}, 
  * \small developing a robust laboratory information management system that records data from sample collection to data provisioning. This included publishing \underline{\textbf{2 peer reviewed manuscripts}} and publishing \underline{\textbf{25 SOPS}} (BeBOP FAIRe protocols).

## Sample Collection and Processing

\vspace*{-3truemm}

```{r scp}
library(gsheet)
dat <- gsheet2tbl('https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18LKb5Foy-P0oiZI6J8-HJ7tYcr-nMh9tYHbOaEGHHJQ/edit?gid=342601147#gid=342601147')

dat %>%
mutate(., `Sequenced:Count`=as.character(`Sequenced:Count`)) %>% 
mutate(., `Sequenced:Markers`=as.character(`Sequenced:Markers`)) %>% 
mutate(Index = (row_number())) %>%
pivot_longer(cols = c(contains(':')),
names_to = c("Process"),
values_to = c("Value")) %>%
separate(Process, c("Process", "Kind") ) %>%
mutate(Index_2 = str_c(Process, Index)) %>%
filter(., !is.na(Value)) %>%
pivot_wider(names_from =Kind, values_from = Value, values_fill = NA) %>%
filter(., Year !="Previous") %>%
filter(., Count !="Previous") %>%
mutate(., Count=as.numeric(Count)) %>% 
mutate(., Markers=as.numeric(Markers)) %>% 
mutate(., Total=Count*Markers) %>% 
mutate(., Count = if_else(Process=="Sequenced", Total, Count)) -> dat_c

```

```{r scp_plot, fig.height=3, fig.width=10, out.width="80%", fig.align="center"}
header <- "Sample Collection and Processing"
footnote<-c("Data switched from civilian to Federal in 2023.")
nickname <- "scp_plot"
alttext <- "This is a bar plot of sample collection and processing numbers."
  
# Select data and make plot
figure <- dat_c %>%
  group_by(Process, Year) %>% 
  dplyr::summarise(Count=sum(Count)) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Year, y = Count, fill = Process)) + # create plot
  geom_bar(position="dodge",stat="identity")+ facet_wrap(~Process, scales="free_y") +theme_pubr() +
  theme(strip.background= element_rect(fill = '#001743'),
        strip.text = element_text(colour = 'white'),
        axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 40, hjust = 1, vjust = 1), 
        legend.position = "none",
        panel.background = element_rect(fill = 'white', colour = '#001743'),
        plot.background = element_rect(fill = 'white', colour = '#001743'),
        axis.line = element_line(colour = '#001743'),
              text = element_text(color = "#001743"),
        axis.title = element_text(colour = "#001743", face = "bold"),
        axis.text = element_text(colour = "#001743")) +
  scale_fill_manual(values=c(natparks.pals("Saguaro", 5)[1],natparks.pals("Saguaro", 5)[2],natparks.pals("Saguaro", 5)[4]) )

figure
```

\vspace*{-3truemm}

**Figure 1.** OME has continued to maintain efficiency and execute sample collection and processing.
